intro: Perezia rigida var. typica, commonly known as the rigid perezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
